name: Drive
description: Adds harmonic saturation and gain to the input signal.

name: Gate
description: Reduces noise and hum when you're not playing.

name: EQ
description: Shapes the tonal balance of your signal using frequency bands.

name: Compressor
description: Balances dynamics by reducing volume peaks and boosting quiet parts.

name: Pitch Shifter
description: Shifts pitch up or down to create harmonies or octave effects.

name: Whammy
description: Dramatically alters pitch in real-time using an expression pedal.

name: Detune
description: Adds subtle pitch variation for width and texture.

name: Multitap Delay
description: Creates rhythmic or atmospheric echoes with multiple delay taps.

name: Enhancer
description: Adds presence and clarity by boosting certain harmonics.

name: Reverb
description: Simulates room or hall acoustics to create space and depth.

name: Delay
description: Adds echo to the sound for depth and rhythmic effects.

name: Chorus
description: Creates doubling and detuning effects, mimicking multiple guitar signals played simultaneously.

name: Flanger
description: Creates jet-like sweeping modulation by mixing a delayed signal.

name: Plex Delay
description: Complex layered delay with pitch shifting and diffusion.

name: Shimmer Reverb
description: Reverb with pitch-shifted trails to create an ethereal sound.

name: Tape Delay
description: Warm analog-style delay with modulation and saturation.

name: Rotary
description: Emulates rotating speaker cabinets like Leslie speakers.

name: Phaser
description: Swirls the signal through sweeping phase-shift filters.

name: Auto Filter
description: Applies dynamic filtering based on playing intensity or LFO.

name: Synth
description: Generates synth-like tones from your guitar signal.

name: Distortion
description: Simulates high-gain distortion effects for aggressive tones.

name: Harmonizer
description: Adds intelligent harmonies based on key and scale.

name: Scenes / Controllers
description: Handles dynamic switching between different tone scenes or effect settings.
